name: Biobased Industries Organisation
goal:
The Bio-based Industries Consortium (BIC) is a non-profit organisation representing the private sector in a public-private partnership (PPP) with the EU, represented by the European Commission, known as the Bio-based Industries Joint Undertaking (BBI JU).
BIC members cover the entire bio-based value chain. BIC is host to a unique mix of sectors that currently covers agriculture, agro-food, technology providers, forestry/pulp and paper, chemicals and energy. With more than 200 members including large companies, SMEs, SME Clusters, RTOs, universities, technology platforms and associations spread across Europe, BIC brings together an authoritative pool of cross sector and multi-disciplinary expertise in the field of bio-based industries.

The Bio-based Industries Joint Undertaking is dedicated to transforming renewable, natural resources into innovative bio-based products.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Climate Action, Competition, Energy, Enterprise, Environment, Regional Policy, Research and Technology
euInitiatives:
Innovation policies & Framework Programme 9
EU Bioeconomy strategy
Circular economy package
Climate change policies a Renewabkle energy policies
